Package com.elle.cellularautomata

Class CellAuto1D

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.elle.cellularautomata.CellAuto1D
  • public class CellAuto1D
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for cellular automaton that does not "remember" its previous generation and thus is always one-dimensional (hence the name CellAuto1D). Created with guide from Daniel Shiffman's The Nature of Code, Chapter 7. Cellular Automata https://natureofcode.com/book/chapter-7-cellular-automata/

        public CellAuto1D​(int rule,

        Constructor

        rule - for cellular automaton in decimal, 0-255 (inclusive)

      • CellAuto1D

        public CellAuto1D()
        Alternate constructor. Default rule of 110 with 333 cells

        array showing current state of cells (expressed in 0's and 1's)

        Returns:
        current generation of cells (0-based)

        public int getRule()
        Returns:
        decimal rule the cells are following

      • getNumCells

        public int getNumCells()
        Returns:
        number of cells in a generation (includes both dead/alive cells)

      • generate

        public void generate()
        Generates cells based off internal rule

      • quickGen

        public void quickGen​(int numgens)
        Generates cell to desired number of generations ahead. If numgens is 0, does not generate.
        Parameters:
        numgens - number of times to generate cells

      • rules

        public int rules​(int a,
                 int b,
                 int c)
        Determines death/survival of individual cell based off internal rule
        Parameters:
        a - left cell
        b - current cell (middle)
        c - right cell
        Returns:
        0 or 1 (death or survival of b cell)

        prints all cell states
